intro: Semecarpus congestiflorus, commonly known as the clustered flame tree, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences that produce bright orange or red flowers. The plant has compound leaves with alternate arrangement and can grow up to 20 meters in height. Its fruits are indehiscent, one-seeded pods that mature into a hard, spiky structure. The tree is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its showy floral display.
